revised_title: Ultra-Microscopic Viruses: Their Characteristics and Possible Nature
tldr: The discussion revolves around ultra-microscopic viruses infecting animals and plants. The authors explore the characteristics of these viruses, their size, and the fact that they can only reproduce in living plant or animal cells. They also debate whether viruses are more akin to ferments or organized beings, and discuss the similarities and differences between animal and plant viruses.
